Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP
@BrownPhilip @watfordgap Hadn’t seen that, fabulous. Quite pleased that my very rough mental estimate of four days to do that is spot on.
@darcysteels Basically, yes! My rough estimate is that Lands End to John O’Groats would take about 4 days, but haven’t actually done the working. Yet!

@watfordgap @politic_animal The record for LEJOG by bus (or, to the best of my knowledge what is still the record!) was set in 2014 by a 16 year old schoolboy who did it to celebrate finishing his GCSEs!
https://t.co/uX9FSpb32E
@politic_animal I knew you'd already thought of it! And then there is the question of just how long it does take to go Lands End to John O'Groats by bus .... 😊

tweets.text: @politic_animal @G_IW If you can make it to the border, I think the free bus pass works for intercity travel as well.

18 minutes late into Haymarket bus station in Leicester, giving me 2 minutes to make the planned connection at St Margaret’s bus station, a few blocks away. Never mind. We just need the next bus to be reasonably punctual! #bus24 https://t.co/KqQa46pbDh
@politic_animal Wonderful journey, thanks for sharing this adventure. Something the celebrate! Now the next question - How far into Scotland can you get from London in 48 hours?! Oh go on .... #Bus24
@politic_animal @WsSeaton How did you get back 😂 ?

@politic_animal You’ve never seen the underground bus bays at St. Lawrence Station in Toronto, I gather?
Like part of a hellscape, it is.

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um
@WsSeaton Yes, Morecambe was where I expected to end up.
@politic_animal The, now demolished, Greyfriars bus station in Northampton, makes Aylesbury look like Lost Horizon's Shangri-La.
@politic_animal "Agitos"
Paralympic swooshes on the roundabout at Stoke Mandeville Hospital, birthplace of the Paralympics. #bus24 https://t.co/lkLOWxeahp
Time for the first Tender Cow of the day. #bus24 https://t.co/CKXniIJnLG
@dixewills @politic_animal That sounds amazing! I was inspired by a book to do Land’s End to John O’Groats by bus, and now your tweet is tempting me.

I clearly am losing it, as I keep seeing signs trying to convince me that I’m in a place called Irlams o’ th’ Height. It does seem to, again, consist largely of dual carriageways. (It’s not a northern thing. We Yorkshirefolk wouldn’t do that to a placename). #bus24 https://t.co/nYx4UGhrGw
@politic_animal Superb thread and quite the grand day out. Out of interest, what was the final fare tally?
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX
@politic_animal There's nothing so picturesque as an historic market place full of cars!
Changing buses at Buxton Market Place. As Buxton is the highest market town in England, it must perchance also be the highest market place in England. #bus24 https://t.co/NtbsJtld6A
@politic_animal @craiging619 Would be good for “OAP”s to know how much it would cost to follow in your footsteps at their concessionary rates 😉

@craiging619 Yes, deliberately excluded coaches. Basically the rule was to only use routes that a older persons concessionary pass can be used on (I’m too young for one, but it’s a useful yardstick!), which excludes most express coach routes.
@thrupneybithead @politic_animal Ace! Recognised this place! https://t.co/ntgdjm0QIm

So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L

tweets.text:
@politic_animal That was lovely. Thank you.

I'm in the USA & I don't think there's an equivalent level trip available here. We have large scale bus companies like Greyhound, & they're designed for long haul travel. A friend used one from Tampa, FL to Fredericksburg, VA once. 850 miles, 25 hrs.
@politic_animal @markannand Don't think the transition would have impressed the Bradford Wool Barons who started and finished their daily commutes there.

@politic_animal I speak from experience when I say that two rush hours is going to kneecap your experiment. I once took a Megabus that spent 2.5 hours inching from Victoria to Greenwich. I could literally have crawled there faster.

data.text: @Jonny_Hallidaye Yes, service only. Going west was largely because Heathrow has very early morning buses (due to flight times/shift patterns), so it was a useful route for getting away from London at that time of day.

@cawi_erin411 @politic_animal Buses are local things. In London, there is one big network and Transport for London sort of outsource it to private companies. They buy the buses and operate the service according to TfL's rules. Outside London, it's a free-for-all and you could get a bus to the next city.
@politic_animal What a treat! Beautifully and thoroughly enjoyable! Uhmmm... Now I have to like each and every tweet! Makes for a good excuse to read it again. Lovely stuff!
@hellomaate I remember the ring road bus! Really infrequent and served no real purpose, but it was sort of nice it was there.

@politic_animal Cool.
So service buses only?
I found it surprising that you went west then north. 
Intriguing.
@politic_animal Excellent thread. Thank you

data.text: @amancalledmikey @politic_animal Canada lost Greyhound, the only company providing national bus service, during the pandemic, due to financial losses. Canada is freaking MASSIVE! Sigh. So here we can either fly or ViaRail train travel if we wo not have cars.

@6shine7 https://t.co/u0OknPovBu

@politic_animal What an epic 24hrs. Well done.

@politic_animal Congratulations!  Marvelous narrative!
@politic_animal Thank you for taking us along for the ride.

@politic_animal By 2am I had the daunting realisation it *was* possible, and that I’d possibly meet a bunch of other people on exactly the same mathematically-provable solution … alas, no.  This is not the UK, home of rail fans.

@politic_animal I can’t remember if I made that table for the first or second of the three “apology” fare-free days.  If it was the first one, then I started planning — a lot like your top post photo — around midnight, on a whim, wondering if it was possible.
@politic_animal Fascinating. Must look further into this. My current obsession is London’s underground rivers. That’s a lie. It was, until I found out they’ve mostly been turned into sewers. Still..

tweets.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP

The next bus is clearly very grand, too grand to have a number. It’s just called Skylink (it serves East Midlands Airport along with loads of villages between Leicester and Derby), and is run by the excellently named Kinchbus. Very nice buses they are too. #bus24 https://t.co/kloog0u2a8

tweets.text: At left, Morecambe’s old railway station. At right, the new one. #SicTransitGloriaMundi #bus24 https://t.co/OeSZEUMNL5

For a journey that included the horror that is Aylesbury bus station, this is a very fitting place to catch the final bus from. Even if it is locked up at 10pm and the late night buses go from the open coach stands outside. #bus24 https://t.co/29YeBeSbQq
@politic_animal Well done, thoroughly enjoyed this trip.... Now looking forward to you doing another at some point on the East coast trying to make a break for the Scottish Border 😂 #bus24
Bolton is a bit too lively for me, of a Friday evening. {I included the tree in the corner of the shot so you didn’t think it was a still photograph.) #bus24 https://t.co/OlvIWFaJNX

tweets.text: @amancalledmikey @politic_animal I was loving the wee turtle. You had me absolutely riveted. I am a big fan of public transportations. I travel mainly by bus, light rail and uber or with friends/family. Being slightly mobility challenged and hard of hearing, travel often causes anxiety.
@amancalledmikey @politic_animal Yes!!
@politic_animal Not a lychee is it?
Been charged with bringing home a present from somewhere I have been through. Do we think this will do the trick? #bus24 https://t.co/KZyb3lYCG7
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L

@politic_animal @cawi_erin411 Would've been even better in the old rickety trains. Reminds me of the time my wife was working on the Cote du Basque and had to get a bus to the border, cross into Spain and get another bus so she could put money in the bank.

@politic_animal @cawi_erin411 I've honestly loved your journey and I looked into it here, given I've no idea when I would leave. The closest thing you could do is something like doing the pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela on slow regional trains where there are stations that get four trains a day.
@FurnessGirl @politic_animal I did before it was restored. Bit cheaper then.
@AlanKelloggs @politic_animal I really fancy staying at the Midland Hotel, just for a night. It’s not exactly a difficult journey for me!
@politic_animal @hellomaate Think so 👍

I clearly am losing it, as I keep seeing signs trying to convince me that I’m in a place called Irlams o’ th’ Height. It does seem to, again, consist largely of dual carriageways. (It’s not a northern thing. We Yorkshirefolk wouldn’t do that to a placename). #bus24 https://t.co/nYx4UGhrGw

@politic_animal Ah, so a wee* stretch as you got off each bus? 
*Pun vaguely intended, I assume that some of the bigger stations had toilets...

@DogImaginary Not so bad considering! About half the buses had genuinely comfortable seats, and I wasn’t on any individual one for more than about 90mins. Did have a few interesting chats, especially as the evening wore on…
@politic_animal I went to university in Lancaster. I go up whenever I can.

@politic_animal Absolutely - it was a bus route that by definition bypassed every place of notable interest. But the stop was handy, it wiled away the hours and always 
brought her safely back home. Ironically Gran holidayed in Morecambe every year, and yes she went on the bus 😆👍

@whophd @politic_animal @UrbanFerryist @kypros1992 V/Line goes even further than Batemans Bay, it goes to Canberra (both via Wodonga and Bombala), they’re coaches though, not route buses.

It’s not much different to how NSW TrainLink trains go to Brisbane & Melbourne.
@Philbuckle @hellomaate Wasn’t it an 8 one way round and a 9 the other?
@hellomaate @politic_animal No. 9 ?

@whophd @politic_animal @UrbanFerryist @kypros1992 One simple rule: it has to be a route bus. Not a school bus, not a coach, but a bus you can hail, no reservations required, running a fixed route to a timetable.

I seem to recall that there were gaps Grassy Head-Stuarts Point, Smiths Lake-Raymond Terrace and Patonga-Brooklyn.
@hellomaate I remember the ring road bus! Really infrequent and served no real purpose, but it was sort of nice it was there.

tweets.text: @Jonny_Hallidaye Yes, service only. Going west was largely because Heathrow has very early morning buses (due to flight times/shift patterns), so it was a useful route for getting away from London at that time of day.
@urban_reverie @politic_animal @UrbanFerryist @kypros1992 Ehhhhh you actually can’t punch through to Sydney at all?  What’s the rules though, which companies can you use?
Time for the first Tender Cow of the day. #bus24 https://t.co/CKXniIJnLG

@politic_animal Cool.
So service buses only?
I found it surprising that you went west then north. 
Intriguing.

@cawi_erin411 @politic_animal In Britain, there's a distinction between coaches and buses. Our equivalent of Greyhound is National Express. It's wildly inconsistent on prices, which I assume is due to old laws. i.e. the traditional route from London to Cambridge is cheap and you could commute on the coach.

@Jonny_Hallidaye No, no express coaches. Problem with starting later is that late night buses outside London are pretty thin on the ground, so you just hit that problem earlier. Most efficient to use some of the small hours on a London night bus.

tweets.text: @amancalledmikey @politic_animal Canada lost Greyhound, the only company providing national bus service, during the pandemic, due to financial losses. Canada is freaking MASSIVE! Sigh. So here we can either fly or ViaRail train travel if we wo not have cars.
@politic_animal A shame you didn't get the view across the Bay to Grange-over-Sands. I'm guessing you didn't get time for fish and chips from Atkinson's, either?

@amancalledmikey @cawi_erin411 I’ve seen similar in lots of mainland European countries. A silver lining of Britain’s weak regional government and haphazard transport funding is this is less of a problem here.
@politic_animal I really love your little videos on each tweet though.  Had it been 20 years later, I would have certainly done as you have.

tweets.text: @Heretoanywhere I do have some international plans when travel is a bit easier!

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd
@politic_animal Did you not get to visit The Statue in Morcombe .
@politic_animal And if you are a pensioner with limitless energy you can use your bus pass possibly. It's not going to happen to me.
@whophd Very impressive!

Lots of people keen to know how much this cost in fares. Done the maths and it’s a grand total of £56.95. For comparison, a walk-up train fare is £73.50. With advance booking a week ahead and some ticket splitting, the train home is costing me £40.90. #bus24 https://t.co/joaT80Trex

00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX

@politic_animal I can’t remember if I made that table for the first or second of the three “apology” fare-free days.  If it was the first one, then I started planning — a lot like your top post photo — around midnight, on a whim, wondering if it was possible.
@LyndSaga I mean, it is basically an oversized stream once you are past London Bridge, but yeah.

@cawi_erin411 Frankly, the UK is behind a lot of mainland European nations on public transport, especially rural buses, but what we have is generally quite usable. And we are definitely getting better at accessibility (e.g. almost all the buses I took are low floor).
@whophd Glad you enjoyed. What is the rail distance record there, out of interest?

tweets.text: 00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6

I read a book on town planning (I know, don't judge 😳) & apparently most of the roads were originally planned as 30mph, but then they changed it to National Speed Limit so they had to have bigger gaps between the roads and the houses, hence all the greenery.

tweets.text: So, quite a few people had managed to work out what the last bus would be. Here it is, the number 40 from Preston bus station at 23:15. Those of you who didn’t work out we were heading to Morecambe will just have to be Wise after the event (oh, please yourselves). #bus24 https://t.co/UUdYwFMa3U

So, Preston bus station. Bloody awful. They should knock it down. JOKE. If a municipal building can be as stunning as this on a damp Friday night, it is a miracle. Shame the top floors are a car park, and it isn’t simply a temple to public transport, but that’s picky. #bus24 https://t.co/VpBGvcvYor
@politic_animal Haha, perhaps I'll try the journey in reverse.. see if I can get further than Morecambe from Skye in 24 hrs. Fantastic thread. Thank you.
@BedeEtherington No swearing on my feed, please.
@CashQuestions My wife made three to while away long train journeys from London to Scarborough…

Further voices from downstairs on the 125 as we fill up on the run into Preston - 
Male voice: ‘I’ve lost my dignity.’
Female voice: ‘Yeah, well I’ve lost my phone.’ #bus24
@shanwilkinson2 Yes, that was almost as much work as working out the route! We desperately need fare integration and consistency.
@politic_animal I am experiencing serious woolly tortoise envy 😳😂
When I am prime minister (matter of time), I am legislating to require windscreen wipers on the upstairs front windows of double deckers. #bus24 https://t.co/0bvWl3Ml38
Derby takes a surprise lead in the Rather Nice Spots at The Back of The Bus Station stakes. #bus24 https://t.co/IrKlbGmH9I
@politic_animal Did the UK never adopt the post office (LPO) as the geographic centre point?  Seems odd, as Royal Mail is as old as any other.  And more of a traditional institution, if anything!

tweets.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
@politic_animal Is the single table for the single meeting that might possibly occur in a single day?
Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU

tweets.text: @politic_animal Enjoyed going through this thread. Do you have a timeline of the journey i.e. like Google Maps where it shows points your phone has picked up?

@politic_animal Thank you for sharing this with us.  I really enjoyed it! It must have been quite an effort to plan connections amongst multiple bus networks that probably don’t offer schedule information in a manner to facilitate planning of such a trip.
@politic_animal Isn't Alston the highest market town in England?
Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP

@politic_animal Skylink doesn't need a number! Everyone in the county knows what it is! It is cheating a bit mind you as it isn't really a local bus service since the routes link Leicester derby Nottingham with the airport (EMA) hence skylink! But it replaced some local ones! 😕
@politic_animal Paging @JonnElledge in case you've not seen this...

@politic_animal Brilliant plan.
I take it Megabus was not permitted, just service buses. I wonder if you stated at say 06:00 you might have got further?

@politic_animal Hey! Don't knock Leicester😋 its all were got & proud to have 2 bus stations. We also have a king! He was buried under a car park rather than a bus station, less busy at the time i guess!😁

tweets.text: @politic_animal All it needed to be perfect would have been a cricket match! Very well done, sir!!
Wandering around the hinterlands of East Midlands Airport, Britain’s second busiest freight airport (we visited the busiest at about 4am this morning). #bus24 https://t.co/lqwfqXkZbq
@politic_animal Side-question:  Why was Charing Cross chosen and when did it happen?  Surely the Tower of London, city walls or anything of Roman heritage predates that.

First independent operator of the day, Red Rose, who despite sounding like they should be based in Accrington, not Aylesbury, have cornered the lucrative rail-less (for now) Aylesbury-Milton Keynes express corridor. Slightly odd buses, with a single table in them. #bus24 https://t.co/yJ1tZybNVC

Crossing the Trent and passing from Leicestershire into Derbyshire at Shardlow. Some people would say the crossing of the Trent marks my arrival in the North. Those people are horribly, painfully, disastrously wrong. #bus24 https://t.co/8Dmlth1Tma
Changing buses at Buxton Market Place. As Buxton is the highest market town in England, it must perchance also be the highest market place in England. #bus24 https://t.co/NtbsJtld6A
@SteCosgrove ah, this was Doncaster to Boro. don't think I managed the other way.

@sfgreenwood @politic_animal Ha ha!
In your defence I think there was a commitment to "wing it" from Boro bus station.

tweets.text: Speeding along the A6 past Quorn, famed (I think) for the world’s only vegetarian fox hunt. #bus24 https://t.co/YgbrqZyzD6

The next bus is clearly very grand, too grand to have a number. It’s just called Skylink (it serves East Midlands Airport along with loads of villages between Leicester and Derby), and is run by the excellently named Kinchbus. Very nice buses they are too. #bus24 https://t.co/kloog0u2a8

@KittyTrill @politic_animal What about this handsome edifice @KittyTrill 

#Newport 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 https://t.co/hDqZzTi4LI
Been charged with bringing home a present from somewhere I have been through. Do we think this will do the trick? #bus24 https://t.co/KZyb3lYCG7
Turns out they have knocked down St Margaret’s bus station, but never fear, there are some grand alternative waiting facilities provided. #bus24 https://t.co/Gy93ji5FAq

tweets.text: Leicester railway station is a very fine thing indeed. Be good if it was closer to the bus stations, mind. #bus24 https://t.co/PfVElrzFd8
@politic_animal @threadreaderapp  unroll please

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L

tweets.text: What with bilingual bus drivers, endless temp traffic lights and general snarl ups over medieval bridges, the 20 min connection between two bus stations in Leicester (why do you need two, Leicester?) is looking unlikely. Luckily, there’s a bit of slack in the schedule… #bus24

So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj

tweets.text: That excellent moment, with 20 minutes between buses, when you find that your endlessly patient wife packed you lychees. To go with the slow travel mascot crocheted Turtle. #bus24 https://t.co/FRg7DWSfOn

Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. But the old bus station was called ‘a portal to hell’ by the local press, so prob for the best. #bus24 https://t.co/GKW1NZiw3t
@torqueback Buxton definitely claims it. But I agree Alston is a lot higher!

@politic_animal Do you have an Old Person's Bus Pass ? I've done Leicester to Milton Keynes a few times and Derby to Leicester, very slow compared with train, but last train is about 21.40 whereas Skylink goes on all night, so theatre/events are an option.

@politic_animal Thank you. From one Commonwealth transit user to another, this makes visiting your lovely country less daunting, because you have better than anticipated public transit. 😁 Canada's capital could learn a lot from this thread if they chose to. Our system is SO broken.
Derby takes a surprise lead in the Rather Nice Spots at The Back of The Bus Station stakes. #bus24 https://t.co/IrKlbGmH9I

@SteCosgrove @politic_animal blimey Ste, well remembered! I got to Richmond one time and Thirsk the other, then took the train, think I just missed a connection both times. It's probably easier to plan these days, especially if you actually, you know, plan.
@politic_animal Isn’t Alston in Cumbria England’s highest market town?
@politic_animal Next time we expect the route & times to be advertised early so followers can join you for sections of the route like a slightly creepy charity fundraiser.

Just realised that by nine am, I’ve ticked off all three of the ‘big’ bus operators - First, Stagecoach and Arriva. First and Arriva are winning so far, because their buses have given me tasty, tasty electricity. #bus24 https://t.co/OXi9Yn6wGy

@sfgreenwood @politic_animal Well Simon if I remember rightly you have some form here yourself. I never did find out if you made it from Middlesbrough to Doncaster by service bus alone, an aspiration we discussed in Blaises in 1987 😂

So?
@BeverlyBambury My wife made three crocheted turtles to while away long train journeys, so they are proper public transport turtles.

I clearly am losing it, as I keep seeing signs trying to convince me that I’m in a place called Irlams o’ th’ Height. It does seem to, again, consist largely of dual carriageways. (It’s not a northern thing. We Yorkshirefolk wouldn’t do that to a placename). #bus24 https://t.co/nYx4UGhrGw

@politic_animal I find this fascinating as well as nostalgic. I used to visit my grandparents in Carnforth by bus from Cambridgeshire, & many of the routes are familiar. I never thought of Morecambe as ‘end-of-the-line’. And the trip used to take me 7.5hrs, so amazing to see it take ~20 from LDN
@politic_animal As someone who has had to catch the x7 repeatedly over many years, I am amazed it was only running 10 minutes late😂
Also just noticed that Belper marks the 12-hour spot. As someone in the replies suggested it is the first place that ‘feels’ northern (and I might be tempted to agree), that seems appropriate. #bus24

@politic_animal I find this fascinating as well as nostalgic. I used to visit my grandparents in Carnforth by bus from Cambridgeshire, & many of the routes are familiar. I never thought of Morecambe as ‘end-of-the-line’. And the trip used to take me 7.5hrs, so amazing to see it take ~20 from LDN

tweets.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP
@alanburkittgray @politic_animal Not starting on a weekday the time that he did.

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt
@politic_animal Reminds me of Chelmsford bus station. ( 25 years ago, may have improved now.)

tweets.text: @politic_animal What I want to know is how many of these trips would be covered by my bus pass. Did sightseeing in London earlier this month for naught. Would Morecambe come to more?
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd

So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj

Just realised that by nine am, I’ve ticked off all three of the ‘big’ bus operators - First, Stagecoach and Arriva. First and Arriva are winning so far, because their buses have given me tasty, tasty electricity. #bus24 https://t.co/OXi9Yn6wGy
@politic_animal @cmitown do not miss this

tweets.text: Passing my favourite-named railway station in the country… #bus24 https://t.co/wHKWHCtESh
@politic_animal As I have a Freedom Pass and bus pass, I could have done that for free.

Lots of people keen to know how much this cost in fares. Done the maths and it’s a grand total of £56.95. For comparison, a walk-up train fare is £73.50. With advance booking a week ahead and some ticket splitting, the train home is costing me £40.90. #bus24 https://t.co/joaT80Trex
@politic_animal So what was your total cost?

@politic_animal Which seat have you been aiming for on each bus?

Presumably upstairs front-right (above the driver) on a double decker, and front row of the 'mezzanine floor' (above the rear wheels) on a single decker?
@politic_animal @threadreaderapp unroll please
@G_IW @politic_animal I remember taking the London to Warsaw, 30 hours of hell
A slightly bizarre trip into the High Peak depot at Dove Holes in order to change drivers, but if you like seeing jacked up buses, this is your place. #bus24 https://t.co/eDMzIJ6n9c

@politic_animal @DurbanSurf eg there are people who live in Hoylake that like to tell you they live in Caldy.
They don’t.
There are people who live in Heswall who moved in from the A41 side but persist in telling you they’re from Heswall.
They’re not.

tweets.text: Market Harborough, where we were supposed to maintain a polite fiction of stopping for a bit and pretending to become a different bus in order to game the drivers’ hours regulations. But we are 10 mins late, so we didn’t. Feels like a town that could do with less traffic… #bus24 https://t.co/OWLjWk0AQG
I love that Belper’s bus station is still one of those drive-in, fully-undercover, half-bus station-half depot affairs. Thought they had all long since been demolished. #bus24 https://t.co/E6pHUARfDY

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um

tweets.text: @politic_animal @gemlav3 👍🏼
Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU
@DurbanSurf I’m from Leeds originally and I tend to hold that Yorkshire is a separate thing from The North! However, in practical terms I’d probably draw a sort of Cleethorpes-Sheffield-Wirral line.
@politic_animal What a really enjoyable thread, encompassing so much of what is lovely about this country, vague eccentricity and public transport.
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L
@fatboyfat Perfectly possible, but would take a good few days!

@politic_animal We had bus for train from Trondheim to Lillehammer, 360 km in four hours. Stopped by some deserted but beautiful stations like Hjerkinn with actual sheep in the middle of the road. The crammed tourist packed train to Oslo was much less pleasant, although faster. Doubledecker baby

Further voices from downstairs on the 125 as we fill up on the run into Preston - 
Male voice: ‘I’ve lost my dignity.’
Female voice: ‘Yeah, well I’ve lost my phone.’ #bus24

The old Slough bus station - concrete monstrosity par excellence - features for a split second in the opening sequence of The Office. The new one couldn’t be much more different, resembling a sort of shiny metallic worm. #bus24 https://t.co/X277i3IjZc
@politic_animal @threadreaderapp unroll

If anyone thought our destination lay in the west …hah, fooled you. Now swinging north into the Chiltern foothills (via Slough Trading Estate, allegedly Europe’s largest) on the first X74 of the day to High Wycombe. #bus24 https://t.co/PKPu2SMTfN
Time for the first Tender Cow of the day. #bus24 https://t.co/CKXniIJnLG
@politic_animal I was wondering how to define that! I was going to say "it's a bus if you can pay your fate to the driver", but it turns out (I think?) you can do that on National Express coaches :-/
@politic_animal What an adventure. Thank you for sharing. Morning Bottie please do me the honour of an unroll. @threadreaderapp

Also, here is a video of me tunelessly whistling the Poirot theme tune while walking along the facade of the Midland Hotel. Amazingly, they don’t shoot people on the spot for doing that. #bus24 https://t.co/1z9fIsk0pU
@CheadleHill It turns out I do mean the 192!
Thread seems to have broken/diverged here due to an inadvertent double post! Continues here #bus24 https://t.co/nB9xZ2gI3w
@BenjaminEHowe Buses only. I defined that by whether an older persons concessionary pass would be valid on it or not.
@fatboyfat @politic_animal I did that 4 years ago. I hear it can be done in 3 and a half days but I stopped off in a few places and took 11 days. Such good fun but an awful lot of planning.

@politic_animal Don't you mean the famous 192?

Firmly back in the conurbation, a land of double decker buses and grumpy peak hour drivers. Hopping onto a 191 at Stepping Hill (of massive south Manchester hospital fame) to trundle towards Piccadilly. #bus24 https://t.co/FKBCD53J2m

urls.title: Bakewell Pudding Shop | Home
urls.description: The Old Original Bakewell Pudding Shop is located in the heart of the market town of Bakewell in Derbyshire's Peak District National Park. It is famous for its handmade Bakewell Pudding, which dates from the 1800s. There is a licensed restaurant, shop and courtyard on site.

tweets.text: Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP
@ccityplanner12 @politic_animal Yes quite. Restock of lychees and onwards to the Proper North!
@politic_animal @johnMcArdle4

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical

tweets.text: @politic_animal Wow! Thank you! Great reportage & video-logs - sort of bonkers but wonderful & utterly sane! Thank you v much esp as I am not-v-well in bed & this is the best sort of travelogue! Marvellous!

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd

@politic_animal Very much enjoying watching your progress. I once travelled around the coast of mainland Britain only using local buses and your videos of bus stations are bringing it all back. Best thing I learnt was that the seat by the emergency exit has the most leg room. Bon voyage!

tweets.text: @intelcymru All carefully planned in advance with lots of spreadsheets! Costs are in the tweet below. I did exclude express coaches (yes, could have got well into Scotland that way) - I used older persons bus pass validity as the guide to whether something is a bus or a coach service. https://t.co/cMUxWO7M8o
@hoskas I think I’d probably recommend the coach as a more practical alternative 😉
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L

@politic_animal This is wonderful. Thank you for prompting so many memories and smiles.
Would you consider trying east to west? I know it would be harder.
@politic_animal @threadreaderapp unroll please
@politic_animal @Al_Humphreys

@politic_animal HELLO! Yes I live in Morecambe and my kids live in London and this challenge has been incredible and will save them a fortune in rail fares,but will also steal a day of their holiday. Swings and roundabout etc. Bon voyage!

tweets.text: Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU

@politic_animal Loving your thread/odyssey, but - and I can't stress this highly enough - Bakewell produces PUDDINGS not tarts. They're incredible and you can order them online: https://t.co/Ob0PYGwftL
@gamblinglamb @politic_animal I thought social media was about healthy debate and respect.
@politic_animal Is Twitter serving everyone this ad at the end of your thread? Who says algorithms don’t do sarcasm? https://t.co/WY2XEyWSW2
@politic_animal @uisgebeatha What were the restrictions? Local bus only?
@politic_animal Awaiting mask report from each stage.
@politic_animal Oh yes, wasn’t suggesting another 24 hour challenge!

Also, here is a video of me tunelessly whistling the Poirot theme tune while walking along the facade of the Midland Hotel. Amazingly, they don’t shoot people on the spot for doing that. #bus24 https://t.co/1z9fIsk0pU

urls.title: Greater Manchester bus route 192 - Wikipedia

tweets.text:
@politic_animal Fantastic thread - thank you.
Tiny nitpick - it was the 192. I only mention it because it's rather notorious locally for its bus war. https://t.co/DU2GbJGfnH

00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y
@SueArcher6 They have apparently knocked it down to replace it with a further iteration, so clearly the original replacement didn’t work well!

@politic_animal Believe it or not it used to be worse than that. They gave it a coat of whitewash and a refurb when they opened the new shopping centre nearly 30 years ago. Before that it was dark grey concrete to add to the “Am I going to be stabbed?” vibe.

Lots of people keen to know how much this cost in fares. Done the maths and it’s a grand total of £56.95. For comparison, a walk-up train fare is £73.50. With advance booking a week ahead and some ticket splitting, the train home is costing me £40.90. #bus24 https://t.co/joaT80Trex

@politic_animal Was it planned or just arrived,quick decisions ?
How much did it cost ?
( #BusPass holders could have done this for free )
Did you rule out express long distance limited stop buses ?
I'm sure Edinburgh could be done in 24 hours ?
Also just noticed that Belper marks the 12-hour spot. As someone in the replies suggested it is the first place that ‘feels’ northern (and I might be tempted to agree), that seems appropriate. #bus24
@SyrinxTemple So I keep being told. I fear the pudding-ites may be pushing against the tide of mass opinion here though.
@wibblegrace Twirlies were a well known phenomenon when I was growing up in Leeds!

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW

@politic_animal What a delightful timeline cleaning thread! As a state pensioner I’ve been surprised at how many of us *twirlies don’t realise the pass can be used uk wide not just locally.
*can only be used after 9.30 round here, hence asking the driver “am I twirly?”

Firmly back in the conurbation, a land of double decker buses and grumpy peak hour drivers. Hopping onto a 191 at Stepping Hill (of massive south Manchester hospital fame) to trundle towards Piccadilly. #bus24 https://t.co/FKBCD53J2m
@politic_animal Absolutely brilliant thread...the final cost/distance tally will be interesting!
In order to begin to acclimatise new followers to the usual fare on this feed, I will now point out that that joke works on two levels, as Audrey Wise was the MP for Preston 1987-2000.
@libdemtim It feels like that sort of place somehow.
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt
Thread seems to have broken/diverged here due to an inadvertent double post! Continues here #bus24 https://t.co/nB9xZ2gI3w

urls.title: Stockport bus station closes this weekend to make way for new £120m interchange
urls.description: A temporary bus station will be set up on Heaton Lane

tweets.text: @politic_animal Last full day for that bus station https://t.co/XR1d789Z7v
@derekbond Thanks Derek! All the gory cost details are here https://t.co/cMUxWO7M8o
@politic_animal @threadreaderapp can you unroll the whole thing please?
Compulsory shot of Britain’s largest brick-built viaduct when passing this way. And extra buses, so they don’t feel like I’m looking at railways instead of them. #bus24 https://t.co/AZjAUl4Ymf
Slow Travel Turtle isn’t sure about these wide roads and great speeds. #bus24 https://t.co/CcCVHZEGBq

tweets.text: The old Slough bus station - concrete monstrosity par excellence - features for a split second in the opening sequence of The Office. The new one couldn’t be much more different, resembling a sort of shiny metallic worm. #bus24 https://t.co/X277i3IjZc
@politic_animal Jo this is WONDERFUL. A question - how much did it cost?! I’d love to see a stage by stage map with time, distance and cost please thanks looking forward to seeing that

@politic_animal They knocked down St Margarets?!?*  The 'new' bus station there was a big glass cube of a building, the old one before that was the most miserable collection of concrete Nissen Hut style shelters you ever saw.

*I expect Mum had told me, and I wasn't paying attention.
@politic_animal So, conclusive proof that Morecambe really is the end of the line. Epic! Well done and thank you so much for bringing this to the world. Safe trip home.
@politic_animal I once got punched in the face in Aylesbury Bus Station. Not one of my favourite places if I am honest.
@fatboyfat Perfectly possible, but would take a good few days!

@politic_animal Hope you're enjoying your tour of the North. 
Are you getting to the Lakes by any chance?
Turns out they have knocked down St Margaret’s bus station, but never fear, there are some grand alternative waiting facilities provided. #bus24 https://t.co/Gy93ji5FAq
@politic_animal This has been a great read. Out of interest, how possible would it be to do Lands End to John o’ Groats by bus?
@G_IW @politic_animal I remember taking the London to Warsaw, 30 hours of hell

So, Preston bus station. Bloody awful. They should knock it down. JOKE. If a municipal building can be as stunning as this on a damp Friday night, it is a miracle. Shame the top floors are a car park, and it isn’t simply a temple to public transport, but that’s picky. #bus24 https://t.co/VpBGvcvYor
When I am prime minister (matter of time), I am legislating to require windscreen wipers on the upstairs front windows of double deckers. #bus24 https://t.co/0bvWl3Ml38

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um

Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. But the old bus station was called ‘a portal to hell’ by the local press, so prob for the best. #bus24 https://t.co/GKW1NZiw3t

data.text:
@politic_animal You mean “the runabout rover away day senior citizens winter break special”
If you’re a one armed pensioner with a bicycling dog travelling daily between Bodmin and Arbroath, you’ll get it for nothing
@politic_animal This has been a great read. Out of interest, how possible would it be to do Lands End to John o’ Groats by bus?
@politic_animal Well done. 😁 I'd fancy following your example, but I wouldn't have the stamina!
@politic_animal The point cinema. Many films watched there in my youth 😁
@politic_animal This has been brilliant!

@politic_animal In my hometown Parkersburg, WV, USA we had a lovely Tudor style train depot.  Long gone now as we no longer have a passenger train stop. My parents put us on the train to Baltimore boarding from that station to visit our grandparents in the 1960s traveling in a sleeper berth.
@politic_animal I like the one that says "Adult Berks Day". Sounds like a song by Half Man Half Biscuit.
@politic_animal And steering wheels
@politic_animal @maryorelse #Scarborough to York is the slowcoach of Train journeys
@Dobablo Yes, that’s the reason for the name (Wenlock was named after Much Wenlock in Shropshire where sporting events were held that inspired the modern Olympics).
@politic_animal Really enjoyed following this. Thank you
@politic_animal Love this thread and I live in Aylesbury! and yes the bus station is the worse thing ever !

@craiging619 Yes, deliberately excluded coaches. Basically the rule was to only use routes that a older persons concessionary pass can be used on (I’m too young for one, but it’s a useful yardstick!), which excludes most express coach routes.
@politic_animal I am now kicking myself for never having been to Morecambe to see the gannet roundabout. Hats off to you for this magnificent enterprise.
@politic_animal Most enjoyable thread for many  a month!
@TheDuisbergKid Had no idea it was a Market Harborough product!
@ORLYSheepboy Ah, how nice. Lovely square and church.

@politic_animal Thanks for the fleeting trip through Northamptonshire and Leicestershire. Made me home nostalgic (not quite homesick) Had to go via Northampton Bus Station for Jury Duty about a decade ago. Was rubbish.
@politic_animal Ah, Buckinghamshire "surprisingly nice".
@politic_animal I wonder if that is the reason for the banking of one of the London 2012 Olympic mascots.
@SuzannePW203 It certainly looks untouched since at least the 70s!
@politic_animal @GuruGosling those seats are known as “command seats”

@politic_animal This is an epic. Forgive the daft question, but presumably as it was bus-only, coaches were ruled out (or you could have got to Aberdeen in one hop)? But when does a bus become a coach?

Enjoyed the evolution from London morning to rural Derbyshire to drunk Preston. #FridayNight
@politic_animal HP sauce used to be made in the building on the right. It’s now made in Holland, still with Big Ben on the label…
@politic_animal I met my, now wife, for the first time right in front of this, this photo brings back an amazing memory.
@politic_animal I used to catch buses from Aylesbury bus station over 40 years ago. Looks exactly the same - grim.
@politic_animal Alex, I have loved this! Thank you so much for sharing it on Twitter. What’s next?
@politic_animal Thoroughly enjoyed your journey on so many levels. Thank you.
@politic_animal There are big plans afoot for Stockport bus station. Big plans.
@politic_animal Thanks for sharing this excellent adventure with us.

tweets.text: Lots of people keen to know how much this cost in fares. Done the maths and it’s a grand total of £56.95. For comparison, a walk-up train fare is £73.50. With advance booking a week ahead and some ticket splitting, the train home is costing me £40.90. #bus24 https://t.co/joaT80Trex
@Miss_Tified_UK @BarneyStringer @politic_animal A log of the legs?
Anyway, probably time to wrap up this thread for now before I thread my entire life into it. Thanks so much for all the engagement, fun and support! #bus24 https://t.co/7qRrB65caP

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um
@politic_animal @willriley100 @bunny6munro lovely thread

tweets.text: Slow Travel Turtle isn’t sure about these wide roads and great speeds. #bus24 https://t.co/CcCVHZEGBq

Also, here is a video of me tunelessly whistling the Poirot theme tune while walking along the facade of the Midland Hotel. Amazingly, they don’t shoot people on the spot for doing that. #bus24 https://t.co/1z9fIsk0pU

(It’s possible that in the breakdown I got some of the ticket names wrong. They are all called things like MegaSuperFirstDayGoldriderSouthMidlandsAnytime and asking for them from bus drivers is an exciting game of mutual incomprehension.) #bus24 https://t.co/qzmoY8fmow
@politic_animal This is just a very weird challenge and therefore has provided excellent content.

tweets.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
@WsSeaton Yes, Morecambe was where I expected to end up.

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt

tweets.text: At left, Morecambe’s old railway station. At right, the new one. #SicTransitGloriaMundi #bus24 https://t.co/OeSZEUMNL5
When I am prime minister (matter of time), I am legislating to require windscreen wipers on the upstairs front windows of double deckers. #bus24 https://t.co/0bvWl3Ml38
@maryorelse My wife made 3 of them on endless train journeys to and from Scarborough.
@politic_animal I wonder if that is the reason for the banking of one of the London 2012 Olympic mascots.
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L

@politic_animal This is an epic. Forgive the daft question, but presumably as it was bus-only, coaches were ruled out (or you could have got to Aberdeen in one hop)? But when does a bus become a coach?

Enjoyed the evolution from London morning to rural Derbyshire to drunk Preston. #FridayNight

Perhaps more appropriately: as the gannet flies, as the most distinctive feature of Morecambe Bus Station is a pair of metal gannets in the middle of a roundabout. Makes a change from the equestrian statue in a roundabout I started by. And gannets don’t start civil wars. #bus24 https://t.co/ly1JmHZuL4
@politic_animal HP sauce used to be made in the building on the right. It’s now made in Holland, still with Big Ben on the label…
@politic_animal I met my, now wife, for the first time right in front of this, this photo brings back an amazing memory.
Thread seems to have broken/diverged here due to an inadvertent double post! Continues here #bus24 https://t.co/nB9xZ2gI3w
Starting to look a touch autumnal in the misty Chilterns, as the 300 rattles it’s way toward Aylesbury. #bus24 https://t.co/o4cPorhPH3
Paralympic swooshes on the roundabout at Stoke Mandeville Hospital, birthplace of the Paralympics. #bus24 https://t.co/lkLOWxeahp
@politic_animal I used to catch buses from Aylesbury bus station over 40 years ago. Looks exactly the same - grim.

tweets.text: Market Harborough, where we were supposed to maintain a polite fiction of stopping for a bit and pretending to become a different bus in order to game the drivers’ hours regulations. But we are 10 mins late, so we didn’t. Feels like a town that could do with less traffic… #bus24 https://t.co/OWLjWk0AQG

Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. But the old bus station was called ‘a portal to hell’ by the local press, so prob for the best. #bus24 https://t.co/GKW1NZiw3t
Compulsory shot of Britain’s largest brick-built viaduct when passing this way. And extra buses, so they don’t feel like I’m looking at railways instead of them. #bus24 https://t.co/AZjAUl4Ymf
@politic_animal Good breakfast? Trust you didn't bump into Noel Edmonds still raging against the collapse of BlobbyWorld in the old Happy Mount Park. Bon retour!
@politic_animal @LittleLorrie1 Probably have engineering works / signal failure on the line so there's a rail replacement service...
@politic_animal @bitoclass How much further do you think you’d have gone if you’d been able to use the remaining time? (And was that left due to exhaustion or buses not running that late/early?)
@politic_animal You said you think you know how far - were you right? Fascinating thread - you travelled through some, to me, much loved places.
@politic_animal Well done, this was highly entertaining. I am glad you had a destination in mind!
@politic_animal They're Bakewell Puddings not tarts, loving reading about your bus adventure though
@plantedaddy I’ve had some great trips on Norwegian buses. I love how they connect at road junctions in the middle of nowhere to hand over passengers and parcels.
Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU
@BarneyStringer @politic_animal He’s keeping a log of costs 🙋🏻‍♀️

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd
@politic_animal Ha ha! @mikeseat you're right about Buxton! 😂
@WsSeaton It was noticeably colder than anywhere else I went, even by the sea in Morecambe at gone midnight!

00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y
@politic_animal Pro tip: don't start from Victoria Coach Station or your total distance will be about 10 feet.
@politic_animal This would have been so much more fun for you if you had got Cliff Richard and the Shadows involved 👍
@LittleLorrie1 By train!
@politic_animal Come to Norway! We have worse roads, but you can go twice as far easy! And there's ice and snow all the way! Jk, great trip, though! Fun to follow along
@politic_animal Was it cold? It's always cold in Buxton.
@politic_animal @CrimBarrister check out this amazing architecture
@aww_maan @politic_animal Good point. Although having done a little online research I think there’s a strong argument for allowing the QE2 bridge southbound.
Changing buses at Buxton Market Place. As Buxton is the highest market town in England, it must perchance also be the highest market place in England. #bus24 https://t.co/NtbsJtld6A
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX

First double decker since leaving London. And it appears to be entirely for me. The X6 arrives at the rather nice substitute for a bus station in Milton Keynes (a tree-lined boulevard) to take me to Northampton. #bus24 https://t.co/MiPHryBDGT

data.text: @DurbanSurf I’m from Leeds originally and I tend to hold that Yorkshire is a separate thing from The North! However, in practical terms I’d probably draw a sort of Cleethorpes-Sheffield-Wirral line.

@politic_animal If you make it as far north as Penrith, you'll go past the last battlefield in England in Clifton, just south of Penrith on the A6
Not sure there's a bus service though 👀
@politic_animal So, where does the north start? I feel it’s one of the great unanswered questions? For me, to keep it simple, I’d say Leeds, but there must be an actual spot. What do you think? 🙏
@politic_animal 😂😂 the only reason we used to go there. Teen day out - train ride, film and a MaccyD’s. Miltkeynians? Lol
@LouiseBrogan3 I have been appropriately educated by a host of Keynesers (?)/Miltonians (?).
@politic_animal The point! Used to go to the cinema there as a teen!
@politic_animal 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻
@martinlewes It is slowly emerging from the cloudbank…
@politic_animal I notice the local police cleared the area as soon as you started up.
@gifford_head Indeed, what was I to expect, coming here in August? Only myself to blame.
@politic_animal You’re nearly in the best part of England!
@politic_animal This was a great thread idea. Congrats on all the new followers.  Well deserved!
@politic_animal Considering the destination, with hindsight, shouldn’t you have planed this trip for the Summer?
@politic_animal Erm... how are you getting back?

Also, here is a video of me tunelessly whistling the Poirot theme tune while walking along the facade of the Midland Hotel. Amazingly, they don’t shoot people on the spot for doing that. #bus24 https://t.co/1z9fIsk0pU
@politic_animal 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻
@politic_animal Bravo! I enjoyed following along a lot.

@Dan__Russell__ @fens_commuter No. Getting north of York is really tricky, especially towards the evening when I would have got there. Scarborough is probably as far as you can get up the eastern side (but it is possible I am wrong!).

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd
@politic_animal @fens_commuter Nice work, surprised you didn't do the Derby, Sheffield, Wakefield, Leeds York, Durham route though. Did they times just not align?
@politic_animal Brilliant. What an epic day.
@Marktech @politic_animal Thank you 😊

data.text: @politic_animal If someone had ever told me that bus journeys would be the highlight of my Friday night I would have scoffed. How wrong would I have been. I have loved following your journey. Thank you
Thread seems to have broken/diverged here due to an inadvertent double post! Continues here #bus24 https://t.co/nB9xZ2gI3w
@politic_animal Thank you for this joyous thread.
@politic_animal So long and thanks for all the … https://t.co/cKlgR54Cz7
@politic_animal Brilliant thread. Thanks for doing it and sharing with us
@chinmj @politic_animal I was wondering when it would come.
@politic_animal Not if you want to keep getting Lychees packed for you. 😀
@politic_animal At this point, you’ve just gone passed where I grew up. Growing up here, everyone south of you thinks you’re northern and everyone north of you thinks you’re southern.
@politic_animal As you were travelling through Wing I was there too. At the GPs, having blood tests. I could have waved at you, had I been aware of this brilliant thread yesterday. Well done 👏 xx

data.text: @politic_animal Come on @JonnElledge the gauntlet has been thrown. How can you resist? https://t.co/oui1n6vpkp
@politic_animal I’m originally from Slough and I did not know this
@politic_animal Thank you for a very entertaining thread, I followed this all day yesterday 😀
@politic_animal Fame at last, @purgstallheath.

@politic_animal Birds of a feather flock together,
Reptiles of a shell go together well
@politic_animal @travellingcoral I wasn’t expecting you to come via my town, Loughborough, in your trek across the land!
@politic_animal That is, indeed, a delightful name for a station!

@politic_animal Enjoyed 
It must have taken a lot of planning?
@DavidAppleyard1 Yes, I was very pleased that the Peak District route worked. There is an alternative route via the West Midlands but it just gets you to the same place at the same time!
@WhatMollySaid https://t.co/3z8qC15S5I
@WhatMollySaid Whatstandwell
@Diverticula Will tot it up later and put it on the thread!
@CarolBN10 Quite a few people have asked that - I will tot it up later and put it on the thread.

@politic_animal Thank you for sharing your journey with us! It was great fun to follow. I was especially pleased to see that your route took you through the Peak District -- turns out the prettiest routes can be the quickest too.
@shedsue I had Clitheroe down for quite a while as the likely location until I found the sneaky late Morecambe bus.
@politic_animal Very impressive feat !

@politic_animal Wow I had to go to bed before you left Preston. Was guessing Lancaster, throught msybe Clitheroe or Skipton but #morecambe is a fine choice for breakfast and the end of an epic adventure. Thank you!!!

tweets.text: Thread seems to have broken/diverged here due to an inadvertent double post! Continues here #bus24 https://t.co/nB9xZ2gI3w

@politic_animal 40 6:40 – 6:57 Lancaster
555 7:15 – 8:34 Kendal 8:40 – 10:14 Keswick
554 10:50 – 11:36 Wigton 11:38 – 12:10 Carlisle
X95 12:46 – 14:49 Galashiels
X62 14:55 – 16:55 Edinburgh
X56B 17:05 – 18:48 Perth
23 19:25 – 20:38 Aberfeldy
@politic_animal @fens_commuter Nice work, surprised you didn't do the Derby, Sheffield, Wakefield, Leeds York, Durham route though. Did they times just not align?

Also, here is a video of me tunelessly whistling the Poirot theme tune while walking along the facade of the Midland Hotel. Amazingly, they don’t shoot people on the spot for doing that. #bus24 https://t.co/1z9fIsk0pU
And now bed. #bus24 https://t.co/x92uPovgOJ

@Dan__Russell__ @fens_commuter No. Getting north of York is really tricky, especially towards the evening when I would have got there. Scarborough is probably as far as you can get up the eastern side (but it is possible I am wrong!).
Compulsory shot of Britain’s largest brick-built viaduct when passing this way. And extra buses, so they don’t feel like I’m looking at railways instead of them. #bus24 https://t.co/AZjAUl4Ymf

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6

tweets.text: Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt

Perhaps more appropriately: as the gannet flies, as the most distinctive feature of Morecambe Bus Station is a pair of metal gannets in the middle of a roundabout. Makes a change from the equestrian statue in a roundabout I started by. And gannets don’t start civil wars. #bus24 https://t.co/ly1JmHZuL4
A rapid dinner and over to the sparkly Shudehill Interchange on the other side of the city centre. Off towards Bolton on Diamond’s number 8. #bus24 https://t.co/QIeLzALE2s
@politic_animal This was absolutely wonderful. Thank you!

Morecambe this morning. It is undeniably dreich, which I hope is of some recompense to those who thought I ought to be able to make Scotland yesterday. You can’t see the Cumbrian fells, or Heysham nuclear power station. One of this is a loss, the other… #bus24 https://t.co/nydlCegdHd
Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU
Speeding along the A6 past Quorn, famed (I think) for the world’s only vegetarian fox hunt. #bus24 https://t.co/YgbrqZyzD6

tweets.text: @politic_animal So, where does the north start? I feel it’s one of the great unanswered questions? For me, to keep it simple, I’d say Leeds, but there must be an actual spot. What do you think? 🙏

Super views over the north Northamptonshire hills, looking across to Naesby, where 1,400 people died in perhaps England’s most consequential battle since Hastings. (And which led to the original Charing Cross, my starting point, being pulled down.) #bus24 https://t.co/I1eaPJpMnX
Also just noticed that Belper marks the 12-hour spot. As someone in the replies suggested it is the first place that ‘feels’ northern (and I might be tempted to agree), that seems appropriate. #bus24
@LouiseBrogan3 I have been appropriately educated by a host of Keynesers (?)/Miltonians (?).
@politic_animal The point! Used to go to the cinema there as a teen!

00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y
@politic_animal You’re nearly in the best part of England!
@politic_animal Considering the destination, with hindsight, shouldn’t you have planed this trip for the Summer?
@fens_commuter Quite a bit - lots of very similar length routes, so a lot of work at the margins. Filled up a few journeys to and from work!

tweets.text: Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj
@WhatMollySaid Whatstandwell

tweets.text: Passing my favourite-named railway station in the country… #bus24 https://t.co/wHKWHCtESh
Meandering up the Derwent valley through Milford. #bus24 https://t.co/VWP7FUEhSh
Derby takes a surprise lead in the Rather Nice Spots at The Back of The Bus Station stakes. #bus24 https://t.co/IrKlbGmH9I

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW

Nice consecutive switch from the X6 to the X7 in Northampton to continue north. Very swish bus, with padded leather seats, USB chargers and the rest, just slightly let down by the fact it is fully branded for a route in Coventry. #bus24 https://t.co/EAGpMVjnwx
Thank you! #bus24 https://t.co/XUP1A7sHFX
@ccityplanner12 Indeed. Very exciting it is too!

00:29 - 6 minutes early after 21hrs and 24mins, I think I’ve reached the furthest point you can get to by bus from Charing Cross in a 24hr window. Morecambe Bus Station, 339.44km from Charing Cross as the crow flies. #bus24 https://t.co/70UakzFv5Y

tweets.text: @politic_animal If this is your accurate route then I think you've managed to travel 262 miles on public bus seats? That's an achievement in itself. Epic planning, pleased it worked out for you! Thanks for a fun day following along! https://t.co/ZQRqpDB7uY
@BrownPhilip Indeed - to be totally accurate, I actually started my journey on the N1 in Charlton, so there’s a good extra 7 miles to add on!

Perhaps more appropriately: as the gannet flies, as the most distinctive feature of Morecambe Bus Station is a pair of metal gannets in the middle of a roundabout. Makes a change from the equestrian statue in a roundabout I started by. And gannets don’t start civil wars. #bus24 https://t.co/ly1JmHZuL4

@politic_animal Crazily, this could be extended even further in terms of distance, by starting earlier across London.🤯
For instance taking the N89 (London's longest night bus route) from Erith to Trafalgar Square: the 0125 N89 from Erith arrives 0239 to connect with your 0305 N9 to Heathrow🤯🤯
#bus24 https://t.co/PhV4Q9TUEk

So, Preston bus station. Bloody awful. They should knock it down. JOKE. If a municipal building can be as stunning as this on a damp Friday night, it is a miracle. Shame the top floors are a car park, and it isn’t simply a temple to public transport, but that’s picky. #bus24 https://t.co/VpBGvcvYor
@politic_animal Apparently this bus is an express because it goes for 1 junction along the M40.

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: Bolton Council’s partially malfunctioning Covid message board verges a bit towards the sinister, frankly. https://t.co/QKLl1PLVxb

I clearly am losing it, as I keep seeing signs trying to convince me that I’m in a place called Irlams o’ th’ Height. It does seem to, again, consist largely of dual carriageways. (It’s not a northern thing. We Yorkshirefolk wouldn’t do that to a placename). #bus24 https://t.co/nYx4UGhrGw
Currently have this pictogram on the number edge of my line of vision and am convinced Stagecoach is trying to sell me homemade jam. #bus24 https://t.co/X2fka6RnWi

If anyone thought our destination lay in the west …hah, fooled you. Now swinging north into the Chiltern foothills (via Slough Trading Estate, allegedly Europe’s largest) on the first X74 of the day to High Wycombe. #bus24 https://t.co/PKPu2SMTfN

@dzyrl @politic_animal Inspired by this journey I have worked out that you can get from one corner of Belgium (Arlon) to the other (De Panne) in a day, 0849 from Arlon arriving at De Panne at 0037. *files knowledge away*

Through the village of Wing, which in the early 1970s nearly fell terribly foul of nominative determinism by being proposed for demolition in order to build a four-runway third airport for London. #bus24 https://t.co/TJYmsBi5vB

Crossing the Trent and passing from Leicestershire into Derbyshire at Shardlow. Some people would say the crossing of the Trent marks my arrival in the North. Those people are horribly, painfully, disastrously wrong. #bus24 https://t.co/8Dmlth1Tma

So, quite a few people had managed to work out what the last bus would be. Here it is, the number 40 from Preston bus station at 23:15. Those of you who didn’t work out we were heading to Morecambe will just have to be Wise after the event (oh, please yourselves). #bus24 https://t.co/UUdYwFMa3U
No sign of any goats. We nearly ran over a fox carrying some chicken drumsticks though. https://t.co/kpvpG0i4eE
@politic_animal I’ve really enjoyed following you on your journey and updating @anthonyzach on where you’d got to. Hope you end up in a comfy bed after all those buses.
In order to begin to acclimatise new followers to the usual fare on this feed, I will now point out that that joke works on two levels, as Audrey Wise was the MP for Preston 1987-2000.
@politic_animal You mean this account doesn’t wholly consist of adventures on public transport?

tweets.text: Speeding along the A6 past Quorn, famed (I think) for the world’s only vegetarian fox hunt. #bus24 https://t.co/YgbrqZyzD6
@JRBrown888 A sort of chocolate chip madeleine. Any shop selling obscure imported foodstuffs!

For a journey that included the horror that is Aylesbury bus station, this is a very fitting place to catch the final bus from. Even if it is locked up at 10pm and the late night buses go from the open coach stands outside. #bus24 https://t.co/29YeBeSbQq

@politic_animal I can never think of the time I spend idling in bus stations as lost; it's a waiting liberated from the three temporal vices of regret, anticipation or boredom, the weak echo of that bliss spent between lifetimes
When I am prime minister (matter of time), I am legislating to require windscreen wipers on the upstairs front windows of double deckers. #bus24 https://t.co/0bvWl3Ml38
@meicapneb @janecolechin @scopperil @politic_animal @SimonDWalsh They were THE most confusing thing to me when I first moved up North 😂
@politic_animal I've enjoyed reading about your trip today.  Hope you got return tickets!

tweets.text: @WhatIsRobShaw @politic_animal I was hoping for Morecambe (just looked it up myself! https://t.co/4vExizIriC). I cycled coast to coast once from there via the way of the roses. Or Wetherspoons (Morcambe Bay) to Wetherspoons (Bridlington) as my team names it!
@nonnie100759 Bit more to come, but the buses run out before I hit 24 hours (which would be at 3am)
@statsgeekclare @WhatIsRobShaw It’s also a National Express coach, so off limits for this exercise!
Nice bit of mid-journey touch point cleaning from Kinchbus while we are stopped at Loughborough. #bus24 https://t.co/AipypNMytT
@politic_animal Calling it! #bus24 https://t.co/xyvkGwsPaO
@WhatIsRobShaw @politic_animal I thought it was going to be Carlisle but that bus leaves at 2:25 and doesn’t arrive until 4:50am so outside the time constraints 😔
A nicely al fresco air to Piccadilly Gardens this evening. The passeggiata is in full flow. #bus24 https://t.co/wPRhHaz9BZ
@politic_animal Think the 40 is going thru to Lancaster

@politic_animal Enjoying this thread.
Still more to come ? Have you done 24hrs ?
@politic_animal Was Preston Bus Station the destination all along? Was this all just a very long Preston Bus Station joke?

@politic_animal Enjoy you final bus journey to your destination! I love logistics. #bus24 https://t.co/Xp5mQKd50l

@politic_animal Visiting with my grandad years ago when I was a kid on one of our days out on the buses & when we got here Preston the bus station was in a terrible state with severe lack of funds on its upkeep it was well worn around the edges, dark & dingy, To see it like this is amazing! 😲

data.text: @politic_animal Ah yes... The slightly merry man on his way home talking to a stranger about his good ol' days... Your deffo in the north now 😂

data.text: @WillPitman @politic_animal Best thing about taking the upstairs front right seat is you can pretend you're the driver!! And get the best views.

@LBACSimon The 100 goes round the by-pass.

I am now prepared to accept I am definitely in the north. I can hear a man downstairs on the 125 regaling total strangers with clearly ludicrous claims as to his batting prowess in his younger days. #bus24
@politic_animal Oh the bus didn’t go into Leighton Buzzard? I was just getting excited at Wing 😉

@politic_animal Myself and an ex-colleague (an ex Prof of Transport Studies and all round travel nut) both thought earlier today Lancaster is probably as far as you get before you run out of bus routes if you went that way.  Also a good location to get the train back to London from!

data.text: @jamesmercer90 @politic_animal @OlegFilimonovic The 40 gets you to Morecambe for 0035, and appears to be the end of the line...but I hope Jo's found a connection I've missed!
@politic_animal Fair enough. A well deserved rest for you then.
@CSDowie Well done!
@BrownPhilip @politic_animal @OlegFilimonovic My money was on the 40, knowing how far and how late it runs!
@OlegFilimonovic Let’s say that is probably the end of the line! Cumbria isn’t well supplied with late night buses.
@politic_animal Ooh are you getting it? Then where? I'm saying Kendal.
@politic_animal 23:15 bus 40 from Preston to Morecambe must be the last leg
@politic_animal @OlegFilimonovic I was just about to say - it's either the 152 to Blackburn or the 40 to Morecambe!
@OlegFilimonovic Haha! You’re the first to spot that I think…

@politic_animal I've no idea who you are, I've not met you, and yet here I am, half nine on a Friday night, looking at Lancashire bus timetables online. There seems to be a bus all the way to Morecambe from Preston. Are you getting that?
@politic_animal Lychees *for* the turtle I think you'll find.
@lewis_baston @doktorb Northwards!
@BarneyStringer @politic_animal He’s keeping a log of costs 🙋🏻‍♀️
@doktorb @politic_animal Onwards to Lancaster or Blackpool therefrom?
@politic_animal Do you have a running total of how many buses so far? And total fare? Would be interesting to compare to cost of train back.
@politic_animal @carinaoreilly lol!
@politic_animal I'm *so* happy that you're going to Preston Bus Station 😊
@politic_animal Your endeavour is just wonderful, ha k you for sharing it!
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L
@politic_animal @JoshFG @doktorb Rochdale Town Hall - Crossland/Waterhouse
@JoshFG @doktorb And Morley, I believe.
@politic_animal Hang in there! You've kept us going all the way down to Devon! 🚍💪🏻
@politic_animal @doktorb Halifax was designed by Charles Barry
Bolton Council’s partially malfunctioning COVID messaging board veers somewhat towards the sinister, frankly. #bus24 https://t.co/QC0gewtnK1

tweets.text: @politic_animal I’ve worked out that you can get a bus further North in around half an hour. #bus24

So, Preston bus station. Bloody awful. They should knock it down. JOKE. If a municipal building can be as stunning as this on a damp Friday night, it is a miracle. Shame the top floors are a car park, and it isn’t simply a temple to public transport, but that’s picky. #bus24 https://t.co/VpBGvcvYor

Further voices from downstairs on the 125 as we fill up on the run into Preston - 
Male voice: ‘I’ve lost my dignity.’
Female voice: ‘Yeah, well I’ve lost my phone.’ #bus24
@janecolechin @scopperil @politic_animal @SimonDWalsh I love a butter pie
@scopperil @politic_animal @SimonDWalsh - "Butter Pie?"
For all those who have been chanting in the replies that I should go to Preston bus station…I’m on the 125 to Preston bus station. #bus24 https://t.co/IxtI9Io40L
@politic_animal Am from Preston! Love our bus station!

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
