tweets.text: I clearly am losing it, as I keep seeing signs trying to convince me that I’m in a place called Irlams o’ th’ Height. It does seem to, again, consist largely of dual carriageways. (It’s not a northern thing. We Yorkshirefolk wouldn’t do that to a placename). #bus24 https://t.co/nYx4UGhrGw
Absolutely cracking town hall, though. Pitch-perfect for the size of the town. #bus24 https://t.co/JnrNmkucyJ
@AgentLittleP It has stopped now - quite pleasant to stroll up to the town hall!
@politic_animal Forgot to say I knew you must have arrived in Bolton... It's started raining 😂
@politic_animal Next stop Preston's iconic bus station.
@politic_animal Blimey, they've not half changed Bolton bus station, I remember when it use to be loads of long lines of shelters like a radiator grill, very nice!
Docking at Bolton Interchange on a wet August evening. #bus24 https://t.co/AqGYWdCSdy

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6

tweets.text: @politic_animal Keep going Jo! How are you staying caffeinated? Is there anything we can do to from the Twittersphere??
@AgentLittleP Aiming for the 21:20 125.

@politic_animal Good luck on the link! If you can try to take in the outside of Preston Bus Station too, it's very unique! Plus you can get bus to Lake District from there too (although probably not this late at night 😂) that's what you was aiming for a little break in the lakes wasn't it? 😂👍 https://t.co/nLGjwS52Cf
@politic_animal How far have you travelled and what was the idea behind this trip?

@politic_animal Looks like you've got a fair way til Bolton lol, btw keep eye on stagecoach's twitter if going thru Preston as some routes lately have been getting diverted but it shouldn't affect you too much, the 125 is fairly quick though so I would say you will be there by 9:45pm
@sarcastic_ali People can sleep on the number 8 with these road surfaces????
Been charged with bringing home a present from somewhere I have been through. Do we think this will do the trick? #bus24 https://t.co/KZyb3lYCG7
@politic_animal Enjoy my commute home (the #8 drivers are used to waking people up at Bolton bus station) and if you get the #1 next I'll wave as you go past :)
The Irwell in the gloaming. (As predicted, I am starting to lose my grasp on things. But Salford’s endless dual carriageways are sorting me out.) https://t.co/ztdo3dB6FZ
A rapid dinner and over to the sparkly Shudehill Interchange on the other side of the city centre. Off towards Bolton on Diamond’s number 8. #bus24 https://t.co/QIeLzALE2s
@politic_animal I recon you could make either Lancaster, Newcastle or possibly Kendal or Carlisle by midnight tbh!
@rachaelfrclarke Not going all the way to the 3am deadline! (Nice view!)
@politic_animal Impressive journey so far - are you having to pay cash for each leg?
@politic_animal How long are you carrying on till? I'm sat in silence drinking prosecco on the decking looking at this view - so I obviously think you're completely insane. https://t.co/Mh78DpqNz2

tweets.text: @politic_animal YOU'RE GOING THE WRONG WAY!!
@TwinsNthings I’m keeping them all, so I will tot it up at the end.
A nicely al fresco air to Piccadilly Gardens this evening. The passeggiata is in full flow. #bus24 https://t.co/wPRhHaz9BZ
@politic_animal Are you still continuing your journey? Was gonna say wouldn't the next one be The Witch Way express bus? Just guessing 😂 btw welcome to the North... good luck anyway & enjoy.
@meicapneb I don’t think you can include Wales in this. It has its own North and South, independent of England!
@politic_animal I’ve now got an atlas and a ruler out, and having a discussion with my wife about the line of the north. She is going for Aberystwyth to Hull
Trams! (Calm down, Jo, we’re not doing trams today.) #bus24 https://t.co/ESbRm4M4wF
@meicapneb Sheffield, I reckon! Preston may well be on the cards…

Firmly back in the conurbation, a land of double decker buses and grumpy peak hour drivers. Hopping onto a 191 at Stepping Hill (of massive south Manchester hospital fame) to trundle towards Piccadilly. #bus24 https://t.co/FKBCD53J2m

@politic_animal Where does the north start then? I thought it was the diagonal line from the Severn to the Humber. Anyway good luck and I hope you make to the best bus station in the world, at Preston.

Crossing the Trent and passing from Leicestershire into Derbyshire at Shardlow. Some people would say the crossing of the Trent marks my arrival in the North. Those people are horribly, painfully, disastrously wrong. #bus24 https://t.co/8Dmlth1Tma

If anyone thought our destination lay in the west …hah, fooled you. Now swinging north into the Chiltern foothills (via Slough Trading Estate, allegedly Europe’s largest) on the first X74 of the day to High Wycombe. #bus24 https://t.co/PKPu2SMTfN
Passing my favourite-named railway station in the country… #bus24 https://t.co/wHKWHCtESh

tweets.text: Compulsory shot of Britain’s largest brick-built viaduct when passing this way. And extra buses, so they don’t feel like I’m looking at railways instead of them. #bus24 https://t.co/AZjAUl4Ymf
@politic_animal I'm sure Alston in Cumbria used to loudly make that claim! FIGHT!!!

Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. But the old bus station was called ‘a portal to hell’ by the local press, so prob for the best. #bus24 https://t.co/GKW1NZiw3t
@fens_commuter Quite a bit - lots of very similar length routes, so a lot of work at the margins. Filled up a few journeys to and from work!
Changing buses at Buxton Market Place. As Buxton is the highest market town in England, it must perchance also be the highest market place in England. #bus24 https://t.co/NtbsJtld6A
@joesarling A brief visit, but always nice!
@politic_animal i do hope you're taking the train home though
@politic_animal I saw this too late - this is where we are! I would've come to say hello - hope you enjoyed Buxton!
@rrspur Certainly not getting that far, unless Cumbria has started running all-night buses!
@politic_animal Are you hoping for Glasgow.
@politic_animal How much planning did this journey take? How many routes were discounted? The planning that has gone in to this is incredible
@molybdomantic Yes, you can get to Scarborough, but no further. The Vale of York is a dead zone for buses.
@politic_animal Ooh, I was guessing you'd be going NE but I guess N Yorks is a bit of a void.
@ValStev24404147 Hope the mayoralty went well!
Past Combs Reservoir, near Chapel-en-le-Frith. #bus24 https://t.co/O8zCqOY4I4
@politic_animal I've missed you. I left Twitter for my Mayoral year and just catching up with lovely people like yourself.

That excellent moment, with 20 minutes between buses, when you find that your endlessly patient wife packed you lychees. To go with the slow travel mascot crocheted Turtle. #bus24 https://t.co/FRg7DWSfOn

data.text: @politic_animal Belper’ as nice spot.  You’ve picked a good route
@politic_animal I was worried you'd end up in the middle of nowhere with no accommodation.
@politic_animal Loving this thread!
@politic_animal Wondering if you get to, say, Manchester in time for night buses to kick in again.
@scsmith4 Yes, I suppose it is!
@politic_animal It's like a *nice* Victoria coach station!
@politic_animal @celestialweasel As a citizen of a rainy country I quite like undercover bus stations.

Perhaps also worth noting at this point that I’m not planning to quite use all the full 24 hours. I can’t find a useful way to employ the last little bit! Don’t worry, still plenty of distance to go yet though. #bus24

@politic_animal If I wasn't so busy today I could have walked the several minutes to wave at you through the window. As it is, probably best to have avoided that kind of awkwardness isn't it really? Good luck to you in the second half
@politic_animal Nice work!!!! This is a great idea (and thread). Love it!
Also just noticed that Belper marks the 12-hour spot. As someone in the replies suggested it is the first place that ‘feels’ northern (and I might be tempted to agree), that seems appropriate. #bus24
I love that Belper’s bus station is still one of those drive-in, fully-undercover, half-bus station-half depot affairs. Thought they had all long since been demolished. #bus24 https://t.co/E6pHUARfDY
@politic_animal You're doing great! 👍🙂
@politic_animal Haunts of my yoof. Waiting for the 118 to Swadlincote.
@EmilTschepp @TwitDinosaur I think so. Unless I get really desperate.
Meandering up the Derwent valley through Milford. #bus24 https://t.co/VWP7FUEhSh
@politic_animal @TwitDinosaur Have you got a celebratory cow planned for the end of your challenge?
@politic_animal Fab! Enjoy your journey.

tweets.text: Derby takes a surprise lead in the Rather Nice Spots at The Back of The Bus Station stakes. #bus24 https://t.co/IrKlbGmH9I

@politic_animal @DownsVideo I've just compared with rail tickets and if you left in the small hours, at the closest time to when you started your journey (5.38) it would cost you £162, or £69 off peak.
@DownsVideo Will do a proper tot up at the end, but over £40 so far, I should think.
Changing buses at Buxton Market Place. As Buxton is the highest market town in England, it must perchance also be the highest market place in England. #bus24 https://t.co/NtbsJtld6A
Up on the high limestone plateau - and in the distance, some of the big holes for getting the limestone out of. #bus24 https://t.co/y0dd7kwg2J
Arriving at Matlock’s cute little rail/bus interchange. Had expected to need to change buses here, but turns out it is another secret through service to Buxton. #bus24 https://t.co/TulnQ26z9X
Bakewell. The Transpeak bus really should have a tart break here. ‘Five minutes for tarts!’ #bus24 https://t.co/oGTOCcbOyU
@politic_animal Nerdy question: How much have you spent thus far on tickets?
@returntogo @politic_animal I've always thought they were two separate items?
Deep in the heart of the gorgeous White Peak #bus24 https://t.co/ZlPA6GuCXm
Meandering up the Derwent valley through Milford. #bus24 https://t.co/VWP7FUEhSh

Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6

data.text: @politic_animal I can tell you that you could travel from Portsmouth to North London by local buses alone, in 1964. Can't remember how long it took. Interesting ride though. That was the good old days when single decker buses were sneered at and comfortable seats for the weak willed.

entity.name: Jeopardy!
entity.description: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show -- with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot -- as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

tweets.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
@politic_animal This is glorious! But how are you getting home?
@simoncrobinson I always thought it sounded a bit northern.

@simoncrobinson That is more plausible.
@politic_animal Perhaps it is the end of the south though?

@politic_animal Oh my. You're going to Derby aren't you? That's where I'm from. The old bus station was knocked down in 2006 but I used to spend HOURS waiting there. It used to look like this: https://t.co/wzNKB3fAZL
Wandering around the hinterlands of East Midlands Airport, Britain’s second busiest freight airport (we visited the busiest at about 4am this morning). #bus24 https://t.co/lqwfqXkZbq

Through the village of Wing, which in the early 1970s nearly fell terribly foul of nominative determinism by being proposed for demolition in order to build a four-runway third airport for London. #bus24 https://t.co/TJYmsBi5vB
@G_IW No, staying on this bus to Derby.
@politic_animal Are you by any chance doing the East Midlands Airport to Nottingham bus route next?
Glimpses of the Leicestershire countryside (and the A42) as we storm along country lanes towards the airport. #bus24 https://t.co/en433g3FlC
@andy_travels Not cheap, but there are some day tickets that cover parts of the route and reduce the cost a bit.
Starting to look a touch autumnal in the misty Chilterns, as the 300 rattles it’s way toward Aylesbury. #bus24 https://t.co/o4cPorhPH3
Nice bit of mid-journey touch point cleaning from Kinchbus while we are stopped at Loughborough. #bus24 https://t.co/AipypNMytT
@TwinsNthings I’m keeping them all, so I will tot it up at the end.
@politic_animal @andy_travels Will you reveal the overall cost at the end? I’m intrigued!
@G_IW Not in this case, no - it’s only using something I could use an over-65s bus pass on, if I had one! It doesn’t get me anywhere as exotic as Bratislava.

A little secret to making good progress is finding a chain of towns/cities all about an hour apart - there will generally be a fastish bus between each of them. The E Midlands provide precisely that. Now on a stretch of the X6 route that has no scheduled stop for 16mins. #bus24 https://t.co/pjNjoacKUK
@politic_animal Oh this is great. Hope you at least make Newcastle but is Scotland a possibility?

Features of the rather nice if diminutive Northampton bus station include a plaque to commemorate the former Jewish quarter once on the site, and the rather chipper lions of the town coat of arms. Oh, and some buses. https://t.co/ZOY9YQpA4v

data.text: @politic_animal This is a gripping thread, and now I'm heavily invested in following somebody I've never met and know nothing about, travelling somewhere I don't know for reasons I won't ask. Godspeed!

@politic_animal Which seat have you been aiming for on each bus?

Presumably upstairs front-right (above the driver) on a double decker, and front row of the 'mezzanine floor' (above the rear wheels) on a single decker?

@politic_animal If your northerly route takes you via Grantham ours easily has that beat. It's just, like, four bus stops welded together in a broken-up potholed car park out the back of the shopping centre by the bins.
It does end eventually. #bus24 https://t.co/pgJqSu9F5D
@a6ruled_WFH @politic_animal Won't that require a ferry?
@politic_animal This might be side effect of how slowly things move through and around it
@politic_animal I once had a calendar of the roundabouts of Milton Keynes. Dead serious.
@SarahMatthew1 @politic_animal If you do get the actual X1 then I’ll make a point of going and waving too. Literally passes the bottom of my road.
@politic_animal I wasn't a Northampton resident in the Greyfriars days, but - inevitably - everyone now is fuming in the Chronicle that the old bus station was closed down.
@politic_animal Yes.
@politic_animal 👋🏻 I’ll be waving when you pass my house! Let me guess, X1 to Brum next?

@politic_animal This is brilliant - how's it all going? 
Enjoy yourself as much as I am following you.
Northampton goes on for a *very* long way, doesn’t it? #bus24
@politic_animal Victoria coach station arrivals is pretty dismal... Hardly a warm welcome to one of the greatest cities in the world.

Nice consecutive switch from the X6 to the X7 in Northampton to continue north. Very swish bus, with padded leather seats, USB chargers and the rest, just slightly let down by the fact it is fully branded for a route in Coventry. #bus24 https://t.co/EAGpMVjnwx
@akersley It doesn’t - the driver was scrolling the destination blind to get round to Heathrow.
@politic_animal I can't find any mention in the timetable of the N9 going to Camden Town?

tweets.text: @DavidAppleyard1 @politic_animal It's got to be Nottingham. Can't miss the chance of going through Gotham surely? There's a tweet in that since Gotham City (and New York) do get their names (and nicknames) from a tiny village in Nottinghamshire.

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt
@politic_animal I'm gripped! I reckon you'll be heading to Derby-Uttoxeter-Stoke and North West from there, or Nottingham-Chesterfield-Sheffield. But which will it be?!
@politic_animal Isn't that the place in the Michael Wood series a few years ago?

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW
@politic_animal You mean you didn't invite the wife along on this epic adventure?!
@politic_animal Where can I get a knitted tortoise??

@politic_animal Just to say that I'm enjoying this thread. What's the ticketing situation been like?
@politic_animal good to see you have the best seat on the bus.

A little secret to making good progress is finding a chain of towns/cities all about an hour apart - there will generally be a fastish bus between each of them. The E Midlands provide precisely that. Now on a stretch of the X6 route that has no scheduled stop for 16mins. #bus24 https://t.co/pjNjoacKUK
@benerationx I rather like the whole set-up of tree lined boulevards, I have to say.
@politic_animal Loving this. Will follow thoughout the day :)

First double decker since leaving London. And it appears to be entirely for me. The X6 arrives at the rather nice substitute for a bus station in Milton Keynes (a tree-lined boulevard) to take me to Northampton. #bus24 https://t.co/MiPHryBDGT

@politic_animal The point has the delightfully apocryphal title of being the first multiplex cinema in the UK. They're going to knock it down soon and I'll be very sad to see it go (sorry, just very excited for Milton Keynes content on the timeline)
@StratfordLeeEsq I have been prudent!
@benerationx The suspension was ok, which is just as well as the driver did like to bounce off every available kerb.

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt
@politic_animal Preston Bus station. I hope you get that far to experience the joys of brutalist concrete architecture in northern England!
@politic_animal Last time I took a red rose was one of the most uncomfortable journeys of my life, utterly lacking suspension. Godspeed
@politic_animal Oooh. 24 hours of logistics.  I hope you fasted before starting.  24 hours with few facilities....
@politic_animal Stocking up at Nandos?
@politic_animal Lincoln's station used to look like this, got completely rebuilt a few years ago, expensive to do
@politic_animal 🙌🙌🙌
@suzyg001 Will be there later - it has been rebuilt apparently!

@politic_animal Fantastic. We once circumnavigated Gran Canaria by bus to see if it could be done - it took about 8 hours.

Love a crazy bus adventure - have a great day!
@politic_animal Northampton's is pretty grim.  Or was.  Might have been rebuilt.
@TwitDinosaur Afraid there’s someone sitting at it, so can’t at the moment!

Through the village of Wing, which in the early 1970s nearly fell terribly foul of nominative determinism by being proposed for demolition in order to build a four-runway third airport for London. #bus24 https://t.co/TJYmsBi5vB
@politic_animal I'm gonna need a picture of the table please, interest piqued.
@politic_animal Preston Bus trialled the tables in their double deckers. This did not last.
@politic_animal Brilliant! Enjoy your 24hrs.

First independent operator of the day, Red Rose, who despite sounding like they should be based in Accrington, not Aylesbury, have cornered the lucrative rail-less (for now) Aylesbury-Milton Keynes express corridor. Slightly odd buses, with a single table in them. #bus24 https://t.co/yJ1tZybNVC
@G_IW @politic_animal I did that return journey one time (picking the coach up in Vienna). That was a long, and very smelly 24 hours. 😷
@politic_animal Good, that's amazingly bleak!

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um
@dzyrl @politic_animal I didn’t persevere. I think I managed to hold on until Windsor.
@politic_animal @G_IW Thanks to our Tory government it is an over 66 bus pass these days. Due to increase to 67 from 2028.

@politic_animal So that's why Nando's have run out.

@politic_animal The old Slough bus station had The Worst Toilet in England. It was like the scene from Trainspotting, complete with junkie.
@politic_animal Of course… I had some thoughts about “knowing from the shape if it’s real journey” and now I wonder how quickly one could circumnavigate London always staying outside the M25.
@politic_animal Is that the kendal mint cake of the bus route explorers world?
Paralympic swooshes on the roundabout at Stoke Mandeville Hospital, birthplace of the Paralympics. #bus24 https://t.co/lkLOWxeahp
@a6ruled_WFH Straight line distance from Charing Cross. Otherwise you could rack up mileage by shuttling up and down Whitehall all day!
@politic_animal Is their a specific measure? And is it miles travelled or is it straight line distance at end point?
Starting to look a touch autumnal in the misty Chilterns, as the 300 rattles it’s way toward Aylesbury. #bus24 https://t.co/o4cPorhPH3
@politic_animal Oh, the glamour!
@G_IW @politic_animal I remember taking the London to Warsaw, 30 hours of hell
The buses are getting smaller. #bus24 https://t.co/xxy3r8PXzc

data.text: High Wycombe bus station. At left, what is claimed to be ‘The UK’s first fashionable face mask vending machine’. A low bar to clear, I feel. #bus24 https://t.co/ZO6OkjnjiP
@politic_animal I hope you've timed your loo visits
Time for the first Tender Cow of the day. #bus24 https://t.co/CKXniIJnLG

If anyone thought our destination lay in the west …hah, fooled you. Now swinging north into the Chiltern foothills (via Slough Trading Estate, allegedly Europe’s largest) on the first X74 of the day to High Wycombe. #bus24 https://t.co/PKPu2SMTfN

@politic_animal A two-and-a-half hour journey that gets you to Slough seems poor return for the effort.

The old Slough station announcer "Slough, Slough... This is [long sigh] Slough" remains sadly missed.

The old Slough bus station - concrete monstrosity par excellence - features for a split second in the opening sequence of The Office. The new one couldn’t be much more different, resembling a sort of shiny metallic worm. #bus24 https://t.co/X277i3IjZc

No sign of any goats. We nearly ran over a fox carrying some chicken drumsticks though. https://t.co/kpvpG0i4eE

@politic_animal Trying to work out if I think you're off on a brave or just nuts. I used to do the coach from London to Tyrone (with necessary ferry) when I was a student. That was 18 hours or so and that was rough - a whole day on buses sounds nightmarish.

data.text: One of the joys of Nightbus travel is the gentle rhythm of stops being announced as the bus swings non-stop past them. This bus is struggling though, announcing random stops wherever it likes, like ‘QPR Stadium’ while in Kensington or ‘Surbiton station’ in Hammersmith. #bus24
@politic_animal Turned on notifications for you so I don’t miss anything!

So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj

@mudlarklives @G_IW Yes, it’s a bit of a vicious circle. Outside the big cities, bus operators can’t really survive based on the level of reimbursement they get for pass users, but at the same time, they can’t survive without it.
@politic_animal @G_IW I think you're right. Unfortunately, that will also contribute to further cuts in bus services, in spite of lip service to "green" transport.
@neilclasper Ha! No. That would be cheating.
@mudlarklives @G_IW I will count myself lucky if any pass exists at all by then, particularly outside London. The economics of it, for both government and bus operators, is not great, unfortunately.
@politic_animal @G_IW A restriction that will still exist when you reach the eligible age. No way that it will be "temporary".
@mudlarklives @G_IW Yeah, I’m ignoring the time restrictions 😉

@politic_animal @G_IW I understand the distinction you're making - eligible local buses v ineligible long-distance coaches - but you'll be aware that London bus passes are now not valid until 9am on weekdays. You could spend another 6 hours in bed.
@politic_animal Ah one of those trips. I've had friends who've done the Lands End to John O'Groats on their passes. Lucky sods.
@G_IW Not in this case, no - it’s only using something I could use an over-65s bus pass on, if I had one! It doesn’t get me anywhere as exotic as Bratislava.
@politic_animal I think I managed to get to Bratislava in about 24 hours from Victoria. Presuming bus also includes coaches.
